revised_title: Anatomy of the Lymphatic System in Amphibious Animals
tldr: The article describes the anatomy and functioning of the lymphatic system in amphibious animals, focusing on a turtle. The author, William Hewson, conducted dissections and experiments to understand the structure and function of the lymphatic system, including the lacteals and lymphatics, and their connections to other organs. The study provides insights into the similarities and differences between the lymphatic systems of amphibious animals and birds.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
